definition: to move/to shift/to change/to alter/to remove
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: A novel mobile self-reconfigurable robot is presented.
sentences.chinese: 本文提出了一种新型移动式自重构机器人。

sentences.english: Air-cooled, shifting belt drive, splash lubrication.
sentences.chinese: 风冷，移动式，皮带传动，飞溅润滑。

sentences.english: Below is a picture of 30G mobile type ozone generator.
sentences.chinese: 下面是30G移动式臭氧发生器的图片。

sentences.english: Just put the books into the book drop entrance and the returned books can be available immediately.
sentences.chinese: 提供移动式书车，书车底部具有缓降式乘载装置。

sentences.english: Materials can be used as portable pump.
sentences.chinese: 可作为移动式物料输送泵。

sentences.english: Movable type doctor blade , transverse reciprocating motion.
sentences.chinese: 移动式刮墨刀装置，横向往复窜动。
移动式的盛屑盘和油箱。

sentences.english: A jackup rig is the most widely used mobile offshore drilling unit.
sentences.chinese: 使用最广泛的海洋移动式钻井设备是自升式平台。

sentences.english: Provide the mobile books cart with lifting loading equipment.
sentences.chinese: 提供移动式书车，书车底部具有缓降式乘载装置。

sentences.english: Objective To discuss the application of mobile CT in neurosurgical operations.
sentences.chinese: 目的探讨移动式CT在神经外科手术中的应用价值。

sentences.english: A fork lift truck can be used to do this if there is enough room at the sides of the trains for it to manoeuvre.
sentences.chinese: 如果轨旁有空间可以使用移动式架车机进行此作业。

definition: to install/to fit (e.g. a light bulb)
